lines.text: See what I do for you? I get groceries and clothes and art stuff and kill people. And do you appreciate it? No.
People belong where they belong. I'm an amateur painter who turns tricks to make the rent. That's where I belong.
Eat, or I'll cut your tongue out.
I went to hospital and they gave me a claw, like some freak. And you marry that man!
[describing what he sees in Vera's abstract painting]
His skin is on fire... he's in terrible pain.
